title: Help!!!!!
content:
I might get 3 backlogs(Python,mech,M1) in the 1st sem itself as I couldn't attend the college for 5 weeks due to some health issues.I heard you get a year back if you have too many backlogs in other colleges(could not find anything about pesu)
Feeling extremely anxious when I think about a year back.Can anyone please say if this is true and is there some minimum credits required to pass the year?

comments.body: It is true if u have more than 24 credits in backlog

No nothing like that. You'll be moved to the second sem and then write backlog paper while writing the 2nd sem ESAs

You've only written one isa right? Study hard to get good in the second isa and esa. First year isn't that hard, you have time to get a good grade. If not you can withdraw the course, but i wouldn't recommend it because it just makes your future that much harder

You won't be held back. You will have to take the ESAs again in the following semesters. 

More importantantly if you have another ISA coming up, you can work hard to make sure you pass in the end. It's never too late.
Thanks and yeah,will try my best
You still have time, try to make the best use of it.
